page.title: 05Nunwell House,Brading
page.content: { NUNWELL HOUSE }is a stately home owned by Colonel and Mrs Aylmer.It was purchased from the Oglander family in 1982.It has 65 rooms,but only 34 are in use.Mrs Mary Oglander has moved into the renovated coachhouse. Living in a stately home today is very hard.Every year the house uses Â£2000 of heat.The Aylmer family do a lot of the house work themselves.3 mornings a week a cleaner comes to the house and 2 gardeners each come one day a week.In the winter the Aylmer family and guests have to wear coats when having dinner,because it is very{ cold. To help with costs the house is open to visitors and there is a cafe for light refreshments.{King Charles}slept here on his last night before being imprisoned.His equerry's room still has the original panelling. {
